text: L. G. "Clayton"/"Clipper" Carmody (1922 – 1997) was an American football player and coach. He was drafted by the Washington Redskins of the National Football League (NFL) in 1947. Carmody served as the head football coach at Central Washington University from 1950 to 1954, compiling a record of 10–29–1, after having been a professor at the University of Washington. ==Head coaching record== ==References== ==External links== * Category:1922 births Category:Year of death missing Category:Central Washington Wildcats football coaches Category:Central Washington Wildcats football players Category:Columbia University alumni Category:Players of American football from Nebraska
title: L. G. Carmody
